verses.verse: And Jacob <S%H3290><s%> went <S%H1980><s%> on his way <S%H1870><s%>, and the angels <S%H4397><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> met him <S%H6293><s%>.

And when Jacob <S%H3290><s%> saw them <S%H7200><s%>, he said <S%H559><s%>, This is God <S%H430><s%>'s host <S%H4264><s%>: and he called <S%H7121><s%> the name <S%H8034><s%> of that place <S%H4725><s%> Mahanaim <S%H4266><s%>.

And Jacob <S%H3290><s%> sent <S%H7971><s%> messengers <S%H4397><s%> before him <S%H6440><s%> to Esau <S%H6215><s%> his brother <S%H251><s%> unto the land <S%H776><s%> of Seir <S%H8165><s%>, the country <S%H7704><s%> of Edom <S%H123><s%>.

And he commanded <S%H6680><s%> them <S%H559><s%>, saying, Thus shall you speak <S%H559><s%> unto my lord <S%H113><s%> Esau <S%H6215><s%>; your servant <S%H5650><s%> Jacob <S%H3290><s%> says <S%H559><s%> thus <S%H1481><s%>, I have stayed with Laban <S%H3837><s%>, and stayed there until now <S%H309><s%>:

And I have oxen <S%H7794><s%>, and donkeys <S%H2543><s%>, flocks <S%H6629><s%>, and menservants <S%H5650><s%>, and womenservants <S%H8198><s%>: and I have sent <S%H7971><s%> to tell <S%H5046><s%> my lord <S%H113><s%>, that I may find <S%H4672><s%> grace <S%H2580><s%> in your sight <S%H5869><s%>.

And the messengers <S%H4397><s%> returned <S%H7725><s%> to Jacob <S%H3290><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, We came <S%H935><s%> to your brother <S%H251><s%> Esau <S%H6215><s%>, and also he comes <S%H1980><s%> to meet you <S%H7125><s%>, and four hundred <S%H3967><s%> men with him <S%H376><s%>.

Then Jacob <S%H3290><s%> was greatly <S%H3966><s%> afraid <S%H3372><s%> and distressed <S%H3334><s%>: and he divided <S%H2673><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> that was with him <S%H6629><s%>, and the flocks, and herds <S%H1241><s%>, and the camels <S%H1581><s%>, into two <S%H8147><s%> bands <S%H4264><s%>;

And said <S%H559><s%>, If Esau <S%H6215><s%> come <S%H935><s%> to the one <S%H259><s%> company <S%H4264><s%>, and strikes it <S%H5221><s%>, then the other company <S%H4264><s%> which is left <S%H7604><s%> shall escape <S%H6413><s%>.

And Jacob <S%H3290><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, O God <S%H430><s%> of my father <S%H1><s%> Abraham <S%H85><s%>, and God <S%H430><s%> of my father <S%H1><s%> Isaac <S%H3327><s%>, the Lord <S%H3068><s%> which said <S%H559><s%> unto me <S%H7725><s%>, Return unto your country <S%H776><s%>, and to your relatives <S%H4138><s%>, and I will deal well with you <S%H3190><s%>

I am not worthy of the least <S%H6994><s%> of all the mercies <S%H2617><s%>, and of all the truth <S%H571><s%>, which you have shown <S%H6213><s%> unto your servant <S%H5650><s%>; for with my staff <S%H4731><s%> I passed over <S%H5674><s%> this Jordan <S%H3383><s%>; and now I am become two <S%H8147><s%> bands <S%H4264><s%>.

Deliver me <S%H5337><s%>, I pray you from the hand <S%H3027><s%> of my brother <S%H251><s%>, from the hand <S%H3027><s%> of Esau <S%H6215><s%>: for I fear <S%H3373><s%> him <S%H935><s%>, lest he will come and strike me <S%H5221><s%>, and the mother <S%H517><s%> with <S%H5921><s%> the sons <S%H1121><s%>.

And you said <S%H559><s%>, I will surely <S%H3190><s%> do you good <S%H3190><s%>, and make <S%H7760><s%> your seed <S%H2233><s%> as the sand <S%H2344><s%> of the sea <S%H3220><s%>, which cannot be numbered <S%H5608><s%> for multitude <S%H7230><s%>.

And he lodged <S%H3885><s%> there that same night <S%H3915><s%>; and took <S%H3947><s%> of that which came <S%H935><s%> to his hand <S%H3027><s%> a present <S%H4503><s%> for Esau <S%H6215><s%> his brother <S%H251><s%>;
Two hundred <S%H3967><s%> she goats <S%H5795><s%>, and twenty <S%H6242><s%> he goats <S%H8495><s%>, two hundred <S%H3967><s%> ewes <S%H7353><s%>, and twenty <S%H6242><s%> rams <S%H352><s%>,

Thirty <S%H7970><s%> milk <S%H3243><s%> camels <S%H1581><s%> with their colts <S%H1121><s%>, forty <S%H705><s%> cows <S%H6510><s%>, and ten <S%H6235><s%> bulls <S%H6499><s%>, twenty <S%H6242><s%> she donkeys <S%H860><s%>, and ten <S%H6235><s%> foals <S%H5895><s%>.

And he delivered <S%H5414><s%> them into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of his servants <S%H5650><s%>, every herd <S%H5739><s%> by themselves <S%H559><s%>; and said unto his servants <S%H5650><s%>, Pass over <S%H5674><s%> before me <S%H6440><s%>, and put <S%H7760><s%> a space <S%H7305><s%> between <S%H996><s%> herd <S%H5739><s%> and <S%H996><s%> herd <S%H5739><s%>.

And he commanded <S%H6680><s%> the foremost <S%H7223><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, When Esau <S%H6215><s%> my brother <S%H251><s%> meets you <S%H6298><s%>, and asketh you <S%H7592><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Whose are you <S%H3212><s%>, and where go you <S%H6440><s%>, and whose are these before you?

Then you shall say <S%H559><s%>, They be your servant <S%H5650><s%> Jacob <S%H3290><s%>'s; it is a present <S%H4503><s%> sent <S%H7971><s%> unto my lord <S%H113><s%> Esau <S%H6215><s%>: and <S%H310><s%>, behold, also he is behind us.

And so <S%H1571><s%> commanded he <S%H6680><s%> the second <S%H8145><s%>, and the third <S%H7992><s%>, and all that followed <S%H1980><s%> the herds <S%H5739><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, On this manner <S%H1697><s%> shall you speak <S%H1696><s%> unto Esau <S%H6215><s%>, when you find him <S%H4672><s%>.

And say you <S%H559><s%> moreover <S%H1571><s%>, Behold <S%H5650><s%>, your servant Jacob <S%H3290><s%> is behind us <S%H310><s%>. For he said <S%H559><s%>, I will appease <S%H3722><s%> him <S%H6440><s%> with the present <S%H4503><s%> that goeth <S%H1980><s%> before me <S%H6440><s%>, and afterward <S%H310><s%> I will see <S%H7200><s%> his face <S%H6440><s%>; what if he will accept <S%H5375><s%> of me <S%H6440><s%>.
So went <S%H5674><s%> the present <S%H4503><s%> over <S%H5674><s%> before him <S%H6440><s%>: and himself lodged <S%H3885><s%> that night <S%H3915><s%> in the company <S%H4264><s%>.

And he rose up <S%H6965><s%> that night <S%H3915><s%>, and took <S%H3947><s%> his two <S%H8147><s%> wives <S%H802><s%>, and his two <S%H8147><s%> womenservants <S%H8198><s%>, and his eleven <S%H6240><s%> sons <S%H3206><s%>, and passed over <S%H5674><s%> the ford <S%H4569><s%> Jabbok <S%H2999><s%>.
And he took them <S%H3947><s%>, and sent them over <S%H5674><s%> the brook <S%H5158><s%>, and sent over that he had <S%H5674><s%>.
And Jacob <S%H3290><s%> was left <S%H3498><s%> alone <S%H79><s%>; and there wrestled a man <S%H376><s%> with him until the breaking <S%H5927><s%> of the day <S%H7837><s%>.

And when he saw <S%H7200><s%> that he prevailed <S%H3201><s%> not against him <S%H5060><s%>, he touched the hollow of his thigh <S%H3409><s%>; and the hollow <S%H3709><s%> of Jacob <S%H3290><s%>'s thigh <S%H3409><s%> was out of joint <S%H3363><s%>, as he wrestled with him <S%H79><s%>.

And he said <S%H559><s%>, Let me go <S%H7971><s%>, for the day <S%H7837><s%> breaks <S%H5927><s%>. And he said <S%H559><s%>, I will not let you go <S%H7971><s%>, except <S%H518><s%> you bless me <S%H1288><s%>.
And he said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H8034><s%>, What is your name? And he said <S%H559><s%>, Jacob <S%H3290><s%>.

And he said <S%H559><s%>, your name <S%H8034><s%> shall be called <S%H559><s%> no more Jacob <S%H3290><s%>, but Israel <S%H3478><s%>: for as a prince have you power <S%H8280><s%> with God <S%H430><s%> and with men <S%H582><s%>, and have prevailed <S%H3201><s%>.

And Jacob <S%H3290><s%> asked <S%H7592><s%> him <S%H559><s%>, and said, Tell <S%H5046><s%> me <S%H8034><s%>, I pray you your name. And he said <S%H559><s%>, Why is it <S%H2088><s%> that you do ask <S%H7592><s%> after my name <S%H8034><s%>? And he blessed him there <S%H1288><s%>.

And Jacob <S%H3290><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> the name <S%H8034><s%> of the place <S%H4725><s%> Peniel <S%H6439><s%>: for I have seen <S%H7200><s%> God <S%H430><s%> face <S%H6440><s%> to face <S%H6440><s%>, and my life <S%H5315><s%> is preserved <S%H5337><s%>.
And as he passed over <S%H5674><s%> Penuel <S%H6439><s%> the sun <S%H8121><s%> rose <S%H2224><s%> upon him <S%H6760><s%>, and he limped upon his thigh <S%H3409><s%>.

Therefore the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> eat <S%H398><s%> not of the sinew <S%H1517><s%> which shrank <S%H5384><s%>, which is upon the hollow <S%H3709><s%> of the thigh <S%H3409><s%>, unto this day <S%H3117><s%>: because he touched <S%H5060><s%> the hollow <S%H3709><s%> of Jacob <S%H3290><s%>'s thigh <S%H3409><s%> in the sinew <S%H1517><s%> that shrank <S%H5384><s%>.
